main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed on 18 April 1952 at Cornerbrooke, Newfoundland.
interesting points: The object was described as yellowish-gold and round, The observation lasted approximately 1 minute, The object made a sharp 135 degree turn, The object was estimated to be 3 to 4 inches in diameter and appeared similar to hot metal, The observer reported seeing a short tail during the object's turn.
witness description: Mr. from The Western Star newspaper, aged 28, with no military experience, considered reliable by acquaintances.
